jobs.description:
Established in April 2001, Genesis IT is a specialist contract, permanent and fixed term hire recruitment business which has delivered services to some of the world’s largest companies. The Division generates in excess of $15 million in revenue each year and continually places hundred’s of IT candidates into the Professional Services, Digital Media, Mining & Resources, Financial Services, Systems Integration, Health Technology and Educational industry sectors.

The technology focused recruitment team forms credible business relationships built on trust and understanding which guarantees an insightful and results driven service.

general.headline: Program Manager at Stockland
general.description:
A program leader experienced in planning and delivering technology enabled business transformations in ASX listed companies. A strategic thinker and advisor working with ExCo and Senior Management to help organisations achieve successful outcomes from investment in people, process and technology. 

I have 20 years' experience in asset management and projects including 15 years in SAP ERP integrated solutions within Australia, Canada and the USA.  My experience covers industries including property, chemicals, oil & gas, mining, utilities, rail and road infrastructure. I have broad management skills and a successful record running business and digital ERP transformation projects with a focus on asset management.

My experience includes, developing the case for change and business case, managing and governing program execution, and leading functional domain experts in SAP Asset Management & Integration.

I have an honours Bachelor degree in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Sydney and a Masters of Business Administration from the Macquarie Graduate School of Management (MGSM) including high impact leadership training from Columbia Business School, New York.

jobs.description:
Program Manager for Stockland who is undergoing a technology enabled digital transformation, operating as the Core Systems Program. The program will replace a number of legacy systems with an integrated solution of SAP S/4 HANA, Ariba, SuccessFactors and Salesforce. This new platform will be enabled by standard business processes and will deliver to Stockland's business the required tools, technology and data to drive operational efficiencies and embrace the digital economy. 

The implementation program includes SAP S/4 HANA (Core Financials and modules PM, PPM, CPM and REFX), SAP Ariba (sourcing and procurement management), SAP BPC (forecasting, planning and consolidation), SAP BW/4HANA (enterprise reporting), Salesforce (group wide CRM) and SuccessFactors (payroll and HR).

The solution includes an asset development and asset operational forecasting module developed in-conjunction with SAP's Custom Development Program in Bangalore.

jobs.jobTitle: Project Manager - Rio Tinto Iron Ore Fuel Infrastructure Project
jobs.description:
$63M Design & Construct contract for Diesel Fuel Terminal in Dampier, WA. The scope of the project includes; 
•	Detailed Design of terminal
•	Civil Bulk earthworks for Ring Beams, Access Road Widening and Drainage
•	Detailed Civil works for footings, culverts, ring beams, bund floor and walls 
•	Mechanical works included structural steel, Piping, Fabrication and Installation
•	Fabrication & Installation of New Steel Tanks

general.headline: Head of Technology Services at Stockland
general.description:
I am a passionate and experienced highly successful IT Executive with both local and international experience in structuring, negotiating, implementing and managing complex IT operating models.  

I have extensive industry experience across multiple sectors including, engineering, telecommunications, banking & finance, utilities and oil and gas.

I possess a very practical style with a strong commercial and delivery focus, advanced interpersonal skills and a reputation for creating successful and effective business partnerships.

•	Over 19 Years experience in IT, 12 Years in leadership positions.
•	Key focus on service delivery excellence with proven track record on delivering optimal service outcomes enabling further growth for business outcomes.
•	Strong leadership skills with proven results in team building and mentoring.
•	Enjoy challenges that require innovative thought introducing new technology & process efficiency.  Key focus on automation and making the complex simple.
•	Enjoy working with customers from end users to senior strategic leaders to achieve their desired business outcomes.
•	Strong stakeholder management experience and technology thought leadership on behalf of business partners.
•	Extensive experience in owning and driving technology solutions to improve end user satisfaction.

jobs.description:
Key Responsibilities
Responsible for the operational delivery of all Infrastructure and Network services at Origin Energy (Australia and International).  This encompasses – Hosting (mid range, Wintel, backup, storage, DB services) EUC (collaboration, devices, access, mobility), Network Services (LAN, WAN, Secure Gateway, Firewalls), Voice (desktop telephony and contact centers), Operational IT security, IT facilities management including core data centers and distributed facilities.  

Responsible for cost management and resulting cost efficiencies required to operate a large and complex environment spanning local and international geographies plus offshore drilling.  The services cover day to day, change portfolio and strategic initiatives.

Current budget accountability represents $90m+ and accounts for close to 60% of overall IT operating budget.

In addition to key operational elements, I am currently the  executive sponsor for multiple transformation programs covering end user computing and network services.  I am also a key change leader for other significant programs including – Cyber Security, Infrastructure Services Strategy (workload to cloud), DC Exit, Operational Excellence.

Strategic management of IS vendors including IBM, Fujitsu, UXC Connect (Desktop, Service Management, Wintel, Midrange, Storage, Data Centre)

Management of day to day operational delivery including project governance for all additional services across IS vendors.  This includes developing operational management plans and resource plans with vendors to meet business requirements.

Governance of all contractual deliverables within the outsourced services, including appropriate engagement between the outsource parties and key business stakeholders.  In addition, SLA management, commercial and contractual compliance to contracts.

Key Achievements

Development and management of significant service improvement program across IBM suite of services including process, policy, technology and project engagement changes.  Key outcomes equating to improved project delivery (cost savings and timeframes), reporting alignment including dashboard reporting (daily & weekly), significant improvements in backup process resulting in improved SLA attainment and provision of policy and procedure documentation.

Contract variations across vendors introducing SLA's for non performance – primarily focused around service uplift across hosting services.

Revised services specification as required for contract extension (Fujitsu) utilising internal technical resource and external legal counsel.

Implementation of a tiered support structure across Wintel and Midrange environments (Fujitsu) resulting in significant cost reductions and greater business alignment to application lifecycle.

Significant involvement with both the Data Centre Consolidation program of work (5 data centres merging to 2) and SAP program – platform uplift and NSW retail divestment program.

Currently working on deploying MS OCS to 28000+ users plus a Sharepoint 2010 deployment to 1100 retail branches.

Establishment of vendor supply agreements, negotiation, build etc.

Product management retails IT services into CBA

Also involved in 'Activity Based Working' pilot

Senior Delivery Manager responsible for all Infrastructure IT Outsourcing - including Data Centres, Processing Platforms, Winel, Unix, Inteliigent Networks, SMS Platforms, Commercial Voice Mail Platforms, Desktops.  Responsibility for $30m+ opex and a further $60 capex spend per annum.  Vendors managed include - HP, Unisys, Alcatel, Airwide, Dell

•	Manage the relationship between Invensys and IBM in Australia, New Zealand and Singapore.  Manage the delivery of IBM services for all outsourced Infrastructure Services and Applications Management according to contractual terms.
•	Monitor and maintain the quality, standards and service levels within agreed benchmarks.
•	Partner with management and business stakeholders across all divisions to ensure that business requirements and ongoing needs are met.
•	Balance contract service usage and highlight spare capacity, revision of overall cost structures and ongoing programs to reduce the total IT spend – locally, regionally and globally.
•	Manage the IT escalation process, Change Control process and accountability for signing off country specific IBM invoices – base services and project work / consultancy.
•	Support the implementation of company wide, IT strategic objectives.

general.headline: Senior Recruitment Account Manager  at C&M Travel Recruitment
general.location: Parliament House, New South Wales, Australia
general.description:
I am a specialist recruitment account manager, working closely with candidates and clients across the travel industry in Australia. I truly believe in working with both clients and candidate to get the best outcome!

Successfully recruiting for many different roles across all different sectors in the travel industry to include:

- Business Development Manager  
- Account Manager
- Commercial/Business Analyst 
- PR/Marketing Executives
- Corporate travel consultants
- Entertainment travel consultants
- Event and Conference Managers

Permanent/Contract/Temporary Staffing.

jobs.description: C&M Travel Recruitment is a boutique recruitment company specialising in the travel industry. We have a pro-active approach to recruitment, and we have recently gone on to successfully place Marketing Managers, BDM's, Account Managers, Travel Consultants, Product Coordinators, Analysts and Wholesale Staff throughout Australia. We run a National desk from Sydney, and we recruit only for the travel industry – from junior to director level, temporary, contract and permanent, within all areas of the industry including airlines, corporate travel companies, retail agencies, inbound, wholesale and tour operators, CRS and online, travel insurance companies, and more.

People2people is a recruitment agency that commenced operations on 1 February 2005. Having worked together since 1994, founders Mark Smith, Manda Milling and Simon Gressier continue to share the same vision and commitment for providing professional and, more importantly, personalised recruitment services. We now have offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Chatswood and Parramatta. 

As a Consultant within the Business Support Team at Chatswood, my areas of specialisation include:

Personal Assistant/ Executive Assistant
HR Administrators/Coordinators
Administration/Office Managers
Business Development Managers 
Customer Service - All levels
Administration Assistants
Marketing Coordinators
Corporate Receptionist

> Maintain current client relationships – regular calls to clients, develop an understanding of client companies and culture, keeping abreast of current salary, contract and market advice
> Manage the tasks of head hunting, identifying and approaching suitable candidates
> Conducting candidate interviews
> Writing job ads, and placing job ads on SEEK and LinkedIn and other Job boards
> Taking on and developing job specs
> Writing candidate profiles after interviews
> Preparing resumes for shortlisting
> Preparing candidates for client interviews
> Conducting reference checks
> Complete after placement follow-up calls with candidates and clients at regular specified intervals

TUI UK are the worlds number one leisure tourism company, operating in over 180
      
      countries and 31 markets, with more than 220 brands and over 30 million customers.

general.headline: CFO | Commercial Director | Business Transformation, Change Management | Commercial Acumen | Business Strategy
general.description:
A passionate and energetic Finance Executive who has diverse experience, commercial acumen and proven success in driving growth, leading business transformation in highly competitive telecommunication, wholesale and retail markets. 

A strategic business partner who has driven major change both strategically and operationally, negotiated key long term deals & led programs that have transformed businesses, improved business process, re-engineered inefficient companies & created sustainable financial & operational models in both the business and consumer markets. 
 
A leader, who loves to build capability, thrives on challenges, is results driven, and prospers in a dynamic, fast paced and ever changing environment.

Key Capabilities
•	Consumer, Business & Wholesale markets
•	Business transformation and change management
•	Process Improvement- Lean Six Sigma
•	Commercial Negotiations
•	Business Strategy
•	Building capabilities and leading high performance teams
•	Bread & butter finance

jobs.description:
Reporting to the CEO of Metcash Convenience the role was newly created to introduce commercial rigour, discipline, governance and processes into the business, to develop and drive the strategy to turn-around and transform the business as it moves to a customer centric organisation. 

The role has full responsibility for the finance/commercial function of the Convenience business & plays a key role in driving commercial success & delivering profitable growth. The role partners with the leadership team to deliver the divisions’ strategic & operational objectives.

This included developing product and customer profitability for Petrol & Convenience customers, re-designing pricing models for key customers to improve profitability as well as developing and implementing the strategy to improve profitability and better service smaller Petrol & Convenience & Route Trade customers.

jobs.jobTitle: Commercial Director (Head of Finance) - Consumer Sales
jobs.description:
Reporting the MD of Optus Consumer Sales the role was responsible for 
•Developing, evaluating and executing Optus’ largest retail transformation to optimise branded retail channel mix, footprint & operating model whilst reducing cost base & improving customer experience.  This included:
 -the development of the strategy and leading operational execution to increase company owned distribution by 40 %,
 -development of valuation methodology & leading negotiator for buying back > 130 franchisees stores, 
 -overseeing the rationalisation of third party distribution, ensuring a smooth exit, minimising loss of customers whilst mitigating risk of fraud, loss of revenue, disputes or any legal issue, development of new business model to address community based and ethnic footprint
•Partnering the business to rationalise & optimise other sales channels’ distribution. This included negotiating & managing the exit of distributors in FMCG/Route trade, exiting 3rd party tele-marketers & exiting under performing small business channels. 
•Sponsoring a project in retail that reduced fraud by 15%, eliminate the need to retain paper in store & improved the end to end sales experience and operational performance for staff & customers.

Reporting to the MD of Optus Wholesale & Satellite Division, the role was responsible
      for:
      

    •End-to-End P&L accountability for Satellite and Wholesale mobile & fixed business
      
      that generated revenue of over $1B.

... See more

Reporting to the CEO of Virgin Mobile Australia, 
•the role had full responsibility for the financial function of Virgin Mobile Australia & played a pivotal role in merging two businesses, reducing cost base by improving & implementing best practice business process, improving commercial discipline & driving profitable growth. . 
•In line with Richard Branson’s principles, the role partnered the VMA leadership team to challenge the status quo by taking on the big players and by being customer champions whilst delivering on the divisions’ strategic & operational objectives.  
•Over the 2 years we increased subscriber base to just below <1m, substantially increased distribution to >3500 points of presence & increased revenue and profitability of the business. 
•Built a high performing team - with little to no commercial exposure and transformed them into a respected group across the organisation to provide solid commercial advice to Senior Leadership team

jobs.companyName: Branson Centre of Entrepreneurship - South Africa
jobs.description:
Whilst I was the CFO at VMA Australia, through Virgin Unite, I lectured/tutored young entrepreneurs who had not completed their tertiary education & wanted to start their own business on how to create a business plan & the basics of finance, marketing & sales. 
The Branson Centre of Entrepreneurship supports budding young entrepreneurs, giving them the skills, opportunities and inspiration they need to launch and grow their businesses. The program is designed to help businesses develop and, in turn, create jobs and stimulate the local economy.
